title: Chinese Solar Greenhouse over PTES - Technical Cross Section
subtitle: Enklava Project | Łódź, Poland | 100% Solar Heating

image_specification.lighting: Winter daylight from south, warm glow from heated water below

main_structure.description: Chinese passive solar greenhouse built directly above underground thermal water storage
main_structure.footprint: 14m × 8.5m (both greenhouse AND tanks below - SAME SIZE)
main_structure.total_height: 5.5m from tank bottom to roof peak

roof_structure.shape: PARABOLIC CURVE - smooth arc like a ski jump, NOT flat

structural_ribs.material: CURVED WOODEN GLULAM ARCS - NOT METAL
structural_ribs.color: HONEY-BROWN laminated timber with visible wood grain
structural_ribs.importance: CRITICAL - show clearly as wooden curved framework

glazing.layers: TWO separate curved polycarbonate layers with air gap
glazing.thermal_blanket: Rolled cylinder on EXTERIOR at top for night insulation

construction.material: B25 reinforced concrete, 100mm thick, GRAY color
construction.waterproofing: Factory sealed - no EPDM on walls
construction.insulation: 100mm XPS boards on EXTERIOR - LIGHT BLUE color

top_seal.vapor_barrier: 1.5mm BLACK EPDM membrane ON TOP ONLY - thick visible black line
top_seal.air_gap: 200mm ventilated space above EPDM, below timber

beams.support: Beams rest ON TOP of concrete tank walls

floor.slab: 100mm concrete with embedded PEX heating (RED serpentine)
floor.growing_beds: 300mm raised beds with soil and green plants

interior_features: ORANGE PEX pipes in serpentine pattern (wall heating 35-40°C)
20m² dark blue solar collectors mounted on interior face
north_wall.ventilation: Small pulpit/clerestory at top with operable louvers

solar_collectors.ground_mounted: 50m² flat plate collectors at 45° tilt, south of greenhouse

houses.arrangement: TWO on LEFT, TWO on RIGHT - symmetrical
houses.construction: STRAWBALE with thick walls (400mm+), natural plaster

background.landscape: Polish winter, light snow, bare trees
background.sky: Winter sun low on southern horizon (15-25°)

key_labels: CURVED GLULAM ARCS - wooden parabolic ribs
DUAL POLYCARBONATE - two layers with air gap
EPDM VAPOR SEAL - black line on top only
GLULAM BEAMS - timber on concrete walls

critical_requirements: Roof ribs MUST be WOODEN (honey-brown glulam), NOT metal/silver
Roof MUST be PARABOLIC CURVE, NOT flat or angular
Tank walls MUST be VERTICAL, NOT sloped
Tanks footprint MUST equal greenhouse footprint - NOT wider
Show TWO layers of curved polycarbonate clearly
EPDM only on TOP of tanks, NOT on vertical walls
do_not: Metal roof ribs - use WOOD only
Flat or angular roof - use smooth PARABOLA
Sloped tank walls - use VERTICAL only
